channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Hospital picks clinicians' least preferred option for new build
item.description: Christchurch Hospital is pushing ahead with a new $150m medical tower block despite its own doctors pleading that it's far too small.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 21 May
item.description: The latest Word Health Organisation figures show the largest daily increase in cases since the outbreak began.

item.title: Fate of rentable e-scooters in Wellington to be decided
item.description: Councillors will vote this morning on whether to allow e-scooter companies such as Flamingo to continue to operate in the city.

item.title: Man charged with murder over Rotorua death
item.description: A 59-year-old man is to appear in court charged with murder over the death of a man in Rotorua.

item.title: 'They need to make changes... they're still doing the same thing'
item.description: Checkpoint - A man suspected to have died of suicide while in a mental health unit should not have been there, and was being treated in a way that did not help his condition, a report says.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ and around the world on 20 May
item.description: Simon Bridges' leadership is under threat, more than 2000 jobs will be axed by two of NZ's biggest employers, a tracing app made traction - and another day of no new cases.

item.title: Air NZ redundancies 'held to ransom' with furlough scheme
item.description: Air New Zealand is looking to furlough some of its cabin crew for three years or longer with the incentive of being rehired first. Some feel they are being held to ransom.

item.title: Dive squad recover body from submerged van near Queenstown
item.description: A body has been found inside of a van which crashed into the Kawarau River near Queenstown yesterday.

item.title: Man shot dead by police was still in stolen car - police
item.description: The man who was shot dead by police in northern Taranaki last night has been named.

item.title: Search for missing trampers finds footprints, brings in drones
item.description: Search and rescue teams are utilising infrared drones as they continue to look for two missing trampers in the Kahurangi National Park.

item.title: Homicide inquiry opens after man's body found in Bay of Plenty
item.description: The police have launched a homicide investigation after a man was found dead in Rotorua this afternoon.

item.title: Four-year closure of station, rail crossing due to Auckland CRL construction start soon
item.description: Auckland Transport is closing a station and a railway crossing for four years to make way for work on the City Rail Link.

item.title: Auckland Zoo to reopen at lower capacity
item.description: Auckland Zoo is reopening to the public next week, but limiting numbers to about a third of its capacity so people are spaced apart.

item.title: Arthur Taylor seeks judicial review after eviction
item.description: Repeat offender Arthur Taylor is back in court after being evicted because of an order that prevents him associating with a woman who lived at the house.

item.title: Elderly Mangawhai couple may lose home in long-running rates dispute
item.description: A decade-long rates dispute with Kaipara District Council could all come to an end this week.

item.title: Potato prices up 18 percent as food costs rise in April
item.description: The price of potatoes rose 18 percent in April, likely due to higher demand and a shortage of pickers, according to Stats NZ.

item.title: Air NZ: 1300 cabin crew lose their jobs, process 'rushed'
item.description: Over 1300 cabin crew workers for Air New Zealand have been told their jobs are being cut, the E tÅ« Union has announced.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 20 May
item.description: Wellington City Council has announced Courtenay Place, the city's nightclub hotspot, will close to traffic on Friday and Saturday night. Read back through today's events here.
